text: Robert W. Hatch (November 16, 1924 – February 13, 2010) was an American football player and coach. He served as the head football coach (1952–1972) and head baseball coach (1951–1954) at Bates College in Lewiston, Maine. He also served as the school's athletic director and instructor in physical education. Hatch as a graduate of Boston University, where he played college football. He was twice drafted by teams in the National Football League (NFL), first by the New York Giants in the 1948 NFL Draft and later by the Baltimore Colts in the 1950 AAFC dispersal draft. ==References== ==External links== * Category:1924 births Category:2010 deaths Category:American football halfbacks Category:American football quarterbacks Category:Bates Bobcats athletic directors Category:Bates Bobcats baseball coaches Category:Bates Bobcats football coaches Category:Boston University Terriers football players Category:People from Melrose, Massachusetts Category:Players of American football from Massachusetts
